Toggl Track is a time tracking applicati: Toggl Track est une application de suivi du temps qui permet aux utilisateurs de suivre leurs activités quotidiennes sur différentes plateformes.
\n 1. Log in to your Toggl Track accoun:
1. Log in to your Toggl Track account.
  2. Go to your **Profile settings**.
  3. Find the **API Token** at the bottom of the page and copy it.

L'espace de travail dans lequel fonctionner.
External reference to link this client w: Référence externe pour relier ce client à des systèmes externes.
The client to associate the project with: Le client avec lequel associer le projet.
Si le projet est privé ou non.
Whether the project is billable. (Premiu: Si le projet est facturable. (fonctionnalité Premium)
Whether the project is a template. (Prem: Si le projet est un modèle. (Fonctionnalité Premium)

Project color in hex format (e.g. #ff000: Couleur du projet au format hexadécimal (par exemple #ff0000).
Whether estimates are based on task hour: Si les estimations sont basées sur les heures de tâche. (fonctionnalité Premium)
Estimated hours for the project. (Premiu: Heures estimées pour le projet. (Fonctionnalité Premium)
Hourly rate for the project. (Premium fe: Tarif horaire pour le projet. (Fonctionnalité Premium)
End date of project timeframe (YYYY-MM-D: Date de fin du délai du projet (AAAA-MM-JJ).
Le projet pour créer la tâche en dessous.
Le nom de la nouvelle tâche.
The estimated time for the task in secon: Le temps estimé pour la tâche en secondes.
External reference to link this task wit: Référence externe pour relier cette tâche à des systèmes externes.
Whether the task is active. Use false to: Si la tâche est active. Utilisez false pour marquer comme terminée.
Creator ID, if omitted, will use request: L'ID du créateur, s'il est omis, utilisera l'ID de l'utilisateur du demandeur.
L'heure de début de l'entrée en UTC.
Duration of the time entry. Use a negati: Durée de l'entrée de temps. Utilisez un nombre négatif (par exemple, -1) pour démarrer un minuteur en cours d'exécution.
The stop time of the entry in UTC. Can b: L'heure d'arrêt de l'entrée en UTC. Peut être omise si toujours en cours d'exécution.
The project to associate the time entry: Le projet avec lequel associer la saisie du temps.
Tags to associate with the time entry. Y: Tags à associer à l'entrée de temps. Vous pouvez créer de nouvelles balises en les tapant.
Whether the time entry is marked as bill: Si la saisie de temps est marquée comme facturable.
Time entry creator ID. If omitted, will: ID de créateur de temps. Si omis, utilisera l'identifiant utilisateur du demandeur.
Le nom ou l'email de l'utilisateur à trouver.
Ne retourner que les utilisateurs actifs.
Numéro de page pour la pagination.
Le nom du projet à trouver.
Return active, inactive, or both types o: Rendre actif, inactif ou les deux types de projets.
Get only projects assigned to the curren: Récupère uniquement les projets assignés à l'utilisateur actuel.
Renvoyer uniquement les projets de modèle.
The name of the client to find (case-ins: Le nom du client à trouver (insensible à la casse).
Search for time entries containing this: Rechercher des entrées de temps contenant ce texte dans la description.
Get entries from start_date (YYYY-MM-DD: Récupère les entrées à partir de la date de début (format AAAA-MM-JJ ou RFC3339).
Get entries until end_date (YYYY-MM-DD o: Récupère les entrées jusqu'au format end_date (format AAAA-MM-JJ ou RFC3339).
Get entries before given date (YYYY-MM-D: Obtenir les entrées avant la date donnée (format AAAA-MM-JJ ou RFC3339).
Get entries modified since this UNIX tim: Récupère les entrées modifiées depuis cet horodatage UNIX.
Should the response contain data for met: La réponse doit-elle contenir des données pour les méta-entités.
Inclure les détails de partage dans la réponse.
Name: Nom
New or Updated Workspace: Nouvel espace de travail ou mis à jour
Fires when a new client is created in a: Déclenche lorsqu'un nouveau client est créé dans un espace de travail.
Fires when a workspace is created or upd: Se déclenche lorsqu'un espace de travail est créé ou mis à jour (Toggl ne prend en charge que les événements mis à jour dans l'espace de travail).
Se déclenche lorsqu'un nouveau projet est ajouté.
Tire quand une nouvelle tâche est créée.
Fires when a new time entry is added (wi: Se déclenche lorsqu'une nouvelle entrée de temps est ajoutée (avec un filtre projet/tâche optionnel).
Fires when a new time entry is started a: Tire quand une nouvelle entrée de temps est démarrée et est en cours d'exécution.
Triggers when a new tag is created: Déclenche quand un nouveau tag est créé

## Setup Instructions

To use this trigger, you need to manually create a webhook in your Toggl Track account:

### 1. Access Toggl Track Webhooks
- Log in to your Toggl Track account
- Go to **Integrations > Webhooks** (Admin access required)
- Click **"Create Webhook"** or **"Create your first webhook"**

### 2. Configure the Webhook
1. **Name**: Enter a descriptive name (e.g., "Activepieces New Client")
2. **Events**: Select **"Client created"** from the events dropdown
3. **URL Endpoint**: Paste this webhook URL:
```text
{{webhookUrl}}
```
4. **Secret**: Enter a secret key for security (optional but recommended)

### 3. Complete Setup
- Click **"Add Webhook"**
- Toggl Track will validate your endpoint
- The webhook will appear in your webhooks list when ready

### 4. Verification
- Your webhook status should show as **"Validated"** (happens automatically)
- You can use the **"Test"** option to verify it's working
- Create a test client to ensure events are received

---

**Requirements:**
- Admin permissions in your Toggl Track workspace
- Limit: 5 webhooks per workspace user

**Event Details:**
This trigger will fire when clients are created and will include:
- Client ID and details
- Workspace information
- Creation timestamp
- Creator information
- Client notes and status

**Troubleshooting:**
- If status shows **"Not validated"**, click "Test" to trigger auto-validation
- If status shows **"Disabled"**, re-enable it from the 3-dot menu
- If events aren't received, verify you selected "Client created" event

**Note:** This trigger uses manual webhook setup as recommended by Toggl Track. **Validation happens automatically** when you click "Test" or when Toggl sends the first ping. The webhook will be managed through your Toggl Track dashboard, not programmatically through ActivePieces.

## Setup Instructions

To use this trigger, you need to manually create a webhook in your Toggl Track account:

### 1. Access Toggl Track Webhooks
- Log in to your Toggl Track account
- Go to **Integrations > Webhooks** (Admin access required)
- Click **"Create Webhook"** or **"Create your first webhook"**

### 2. Configure the Webhook
1. **Name**: Enter a descriptive name (e.g., "Activepieces New Project")
2. **Events**: Select **"Project created"** from the events dropdown
3. **URL Endpoint**: Paste this webhook URL:
```text
{{webhookUrl}}
```
4. **Secret**: Enter a secret key for security (optional but recommended)

### 3. Complete Setup
- Click **"Add Webhook"**
- Toggl Track will validate your endpoint
- The webhook will appear in your webhooks list when ready

### 4. Verification
- Your webhook status should show as **"Validated"** (happens automatically)
- You can use the **"Test"** option to verify it's working
- Create a test project to ensure events are received

---

**Requirements:**
- Admin permissions in your Toggl Track workspace
- Limit: 5 webhooks per workspace user

**Event Details:**
This trigger will fire when projects are created and will include:
- Project ID and details
- Workspace information
- Client association (if any)
- Creation timestamp
- Creator information
- Project settings (color, billable status, etc.)

**Troubleshooting:**
- If status shows **"Not validated"**, click "Test" to trigger auto-validation
- If status shows **"Disabled"**, re-enable it from the 3-dot menu
- If events aren't received, verify you selected "Project created" event

**Note:** This trigger uses manual webhook setup as recommended by Toggl Track. **Validation happens automatically** when you click "Test" or when Toggl sends the first ping. The webhook will be managed through your Toggl Track dashboard, not programmatically through ActivePieces.

## Setup Instructions

To use this trigger, you need to manually create a webhook in your Toggl Track account:

### 1. Access Toggl Track Webhooks
- Log in to your Toggl Track account
- Go to **Integrations > Webhooks** (Admin access required)
- Click **"Create Webhook"** or **"Create your first webhook"**

### 2. Configure the Webhook
1. **Name**: Enter a descriptive name (e.g., "Activepieces New Task")
2. **Events**: Select **"Task created"** from the events dropdown
3. **URL Endpoint**: Paste this webhook URL:
```text
{{webhookUrl}}
```
4. **Secret**: Enter a secret key for security (optional but recommended)

### 3. Complete Setup
- Click **"Add Webhook"**
- Toggl Track will validate your endpoint
- The webhook will appear in your webhooks list when ready

### 4. Verification
- Your webhook status should show as **"Validated"** (happens automatically)
- You can use the **"Test"** option to verify it's working
- Create a test task to ensure events are received

---

**Requirements:**
- Admin permissions in your Toggl Track workspace
- Limit: 5 webhooks per workspace user

**Event Details:**
This trigger will fire when tasks are created and will include:
- Task ID and details
- Project association
- Workspace information
- Creation timestamp
- Creator information
- Task settings (estimated time, active status, etc.)

**Note:** You can filter tasks by project using the optional project filter above.

**Troubleshooting:**
- If status shows **"Not validated"**, click "Test" to trigger auto-validation
- If status shows **"Disabled"**, re-enable it from the 3-dot menu
- If events aren't received, verify you selected "Task created" event

**Note:** This trigger uses manual webhook setup as recommended by Toggl Track. **Validation happens automatically** when you click "Test" or when Toggl sends the first ping. The webhook will be managed through your Toggl Track dashboard, not programmatically through ActivePieces.

## Setup Instructions

To use this trigger, you need to manually create a webhook in your Toggl Track account:

### 1. Access Toggl Track Webhooks
- Log in to your Toggl Track account
- Go to **Integrations > Webhooks** (Admin access required)
- Click **"Create Webhook"** or **"Create your first webhook"**

### 2. Configure the Webhook
1. **Name**: Enter a descriptive name (e.g., "Activepieces New Time Entry")
2. **Events**: Select **"Time entry created"** from the events dropdown
3. **URL Endpoint**: Paste this webhook URL:
```text
{{webhookUrl}}
```
4. **Secret**: Enter a secret key for security (optional but recommended)

### 3. Complete Setup
- Click **"Add Webhook"**
- Toggl Track will validate your endpoint
- The webhook will appear in your webhooks list when ready

### 4. Verification
- Your webhook status should show as **"Validated"** (happens automatically)
- You can use the **"Test"** option to verify it's working
- Create a test time entry to ensure events are received

---

**Requirements:**
- Admin permissions in your Toggl Track workspace
- Limit: 5 webhooks per workspace user

**Event Details:**
This trigger will fire when time entries are created and will include:
- Time entry ID and details
- Start/stop times and duration
- Project and task associations (if any)
- Workspace information
- Description and tags
- Creator information
- Billable status

**Note:** You can filter time entries by project and task using the optional filters above.

**Troubleshooting:**
- If status shows **"Not validated"**, click "Test" to trigger auto-validation
- If status shows **"Disabled"**, re-enable it from the 3-dot menu
- If events aren't received, verify you selected "Time entry created" event

**Note:** This trigger uses manual webhook setup as recommended by Toggl Track. **Validation happens automatically** when you click "Test" or when Toggl sends the first ping. The webhook will be managed through your Toggl Track dashboard, not programmatically through ActivePieces.
